subject: Sales
title: Roman Markets and Brand Marks
description: A quick, practical guide to Roman Markets and Brand Marks.

hook.text: Roman bakers stamped bread with unique symbols. Buyers trusted the mark, not just the individual loaf.

buildup.text: Rome's empire needed consistent quality at scale. Brand marks became the first form of product branding.

discovery.text: Pompeii's ruins reveal painted shop signs, product claims, and customer testimonials carved into walls.

twist.text: Roman sellers caught faking product origins faced early consumer fraud laws dating back to 200 BC.

climax.text: Rome proved that trust at scale demands a recognizable brand â€” a lesson unchanged in two thousand years.

punchline.text: Branding started with a baker's stamp in ancient Rome.

quiz.question: Why did Roman bakers stamp their bread?
options: To create brand recognition and trust
